column4: hey, this probably is a newbie question but firestarter is showing a bunch of blocked connections on ports 137/138 to samba - is this normal?
pretty normal on mine
your machine spamming others?
thats what the university's cisco system said
your linux box?
yep
do you let other people use it?
no, i am the only user
hmmm seems strange...you using a strong password?
so you were testing your security on sheildsup?
often the ends up scanning the proxy you connect through I believe and not your machine
oh, thats probably what happened then - and they by doing that, i triggered the cisco system to lock me out
I was testing on sheildsup and wondered why my ports weren't showing as hidden and then it was explained to me that it was my ISP's ports that were not sheilded, so the scan report was erroneous
you may be the victim of an over-zealous administrator :)
yeah..I doubt your box got hacked :)
not unless someone had physical access to it
do you run any services on the box? like ssh? or web server or ftp server?
I wouldnt want to test it :)
explain what you found about sheildsup before setting off any more alarms with the admins
I strongly doubt you've been hacked
you mean the results i got on sunday?
yeah
I reckon that is what the issue was...
sheildsup was probably port scanning them on not your machine
